title: Manager, Display Quality Engineering
summary: Apple is looking for a world-class Display Quality Engineer to lead the engineering and manufacturing activities to launch the next-generation display technologies for the displays in award-winning Apple products.
description:
New Product Introduction:
-Acts as a leading engineer to drive overall quality system development & quality control tool development to deliver scalable product.
-Review product/process design documents and specifications to ensure alignment with process capability and yield target.
-Present timely, concise reports and plans for product yield performance, specification convergence status; drive it through failure analysis, corrective action implementation, and yield bridge to mass production.

Quality Control Setup & Execution:
-Review supplier’s quality control flow, in-process quality control system, incoming components and outgoing product’s quality control plan. Identify shortfalls and corrective actions to ensure design and yield target compliance.
-Work with supplier process/quality teams to map out process development exercises, secure resources, secure FA in order to improve yield and commit to schedules in line with program goals.
-Assess supplier’s production readiness to support build events and production ramp. Identify potential execution issues and provide recommendations to mitigate risk. 
-Ensure processes and suppliers are performing as expected during production ramp, immediately addressing escalations.
-Monitor supplier’s process performance, and yield loss at different process nodes periodically to prevent quality issue.
preferred_qualifications:
Industry or academic experience in display technologies such as LCD and OLED.
In-depth understanding of Display Modules and Display components, in the area of Optical, Electrical or Physics perspective.
Proven ability to drive vendors in Display Quality improvement. Capability to plan DOEs, execute failure analysis, data analysis, and come up with yield/quality improvement path.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Knowledge of Display panels, Display Modules or Components (Optical, Electrical and Material science, Mechanical and Process engineering)
